result.execSummary:
The defendant William Douglas Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William Douglas Lee is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • William Douglas Lee was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William Douglas Lee

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 11:09 Defendant William Douglas Lee in court with attorney Anthony Edward Ho.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Both parties have reviewed the PSI. O'Sullivan: recommends sentenced to time served. Defendant is currently on probation. Atty Ho adresses the court regarding sentencing. Attorney Ho allows court to review certificates of programs that defendant has completed. Atty Ho requests that court accept plea agreement and defendant receive credit for time served.  Defendant addresses the court.  Defendant's sister addresses the court. Court addresses the defendant. Court sentences defendant to time served. Appeal Rights given to  11:29
copy of PSI was faxed to Atty Froelich and Atty Ho ( 9:56am)
Sentencing hearing at 04-19-2016 11:00 am.

11:21 a.m.  Defendant William Douglas Lee in court with attorney Anthony Edward Ho.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  O'Sullivan - state moves to dismiss counts 1 and 3, plead to count 2, time served.  Atty Ho in agreement.    Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.   Off the record at 11:31 a.m.  Back on the record at 11:42 a.m.  O'Sullivan has reviewed previous files regarding PSI and sentencing.  State's recommendation to remain the same.  Ho addresses the court and is in agreement with State's recommendation.      Constitutional rights explained to defendant.    Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Count 2.    Facts are correct.    COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 2.  Court dismisses Count 1 and Count 3.  Court orders PSI.  Bond to continue.  See JA for sentencing date.
Plea hearing at 02-22-2016 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference at 12-01-2015 10:15 am.
by Atty Ho to appear via phone for Oral Ruling

4:02  Defendant William Douglas Lee in court with attorney Anthony E. Ho who appears by telephone.   Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds probable cause for the search warrant and the motion is denied on this issue. OSullivan and the JA will contact atty Ho tomorrow for additional scheduling.
from Atty Ho's office requesting to reschedule motion hearing.
Preliminary Hearing, Arraignment held on June 25, 2015 with Judge Boles presiding. Filed by RMR T Carlson
Oral ruling at 10-26-2015 03:30 pm.

3:48 Defendant William Douglas Lee in court with attorney Anthony E. Ho.  Defendant William Douglas Lee in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion(S) to Dismiss filed by Atty Ho. Atty Ho addresses limits to motions to probably cause in complaint and preliminary hearing to Ct#1. Atty OSullivan addresses. Atty Ho addresses.  Court reviews statutue. OSullivan addresses. Atty Ho responds; states not enough evidence to bind him over for trial. Court: based on the information of the complaint and search warrant there is probable cause for the charge. Atty OSullivan requests a transcript from the preliminary hearing. Ready in 15 days. Court : set for an oral decision within 30 days. Atty Ho brings up work release at Dunn County on another matter. Wishes to address this matter now.  Court: can order huber but sheriff's rule apply. Find out the reason of the denial of huber.
Defendant's Supplemental filed by Atty Ho
filed by Atty Ho
Motion hearing at 09-08-2015 03:15 pm.  JA emailed SB to advise of date.
State's

ADDRESS INFO for William Douglas Lee
Current: 914 Coulee Trail, Hudson, WI 54016 United States  (Effective: 06-25-2015)
Prior: Lot 191 Evergreen Estates, Ellsworth, WI 54011
Pre-trial conference at 07-21-2015 10:45 am.
Def pleas not guilty to all 3 counts. Court enters in not guilty pleas. Court goes over bond conditions with Def.

4:01 Defendant William Douglas Lee in court with attorney Anthony E. Ho.  Defendant William Douglas Lee in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Investigator Douglas Ducklow swn, ex by OSullivan. ID's def. Court: record will reflect indentification. Atty Ho x ex. Atty OSullivan redirect. Atty Ho re x ex. OSullivan: judicial notice of 13CF147. Court: sufficent evidence to show the Def probably committed a felony and binds the Def over for trial. OSullivan files information; Def has a copy. Court reads charges and maximum penalties.   Defendant waives reading of the information. Atty OSullivan  states the Evergreen Ests is no longer a valid address. Atty Ho addresses return of cell phone.

10:30 Defendant William Douglas Lee in court with attorney Anthony E. Ho, who appeared via phone.  Defendant William Douglas Lee in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty HO is requesting a signature bond; Def has job and can't work on a cash bond. OSullivan: objects to signature bond. Court: subject to motion to modify bond to a cash, modifies to a $5000 signature bond.
filed by Atty Ho
Preliminary hearing at 06-25-2015 04:00 pm

4:00  Defendant William Douglas Lee in court with attorney Anthony E. Ho who appears by telephone.   Defendant William Douglas Lee in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has copy of complaint  Defendant waives reading of the complaint  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights    Def waives time limits for preliminary hearing Court reviews the bond conditions with the defendant. The address, phone # and DOB are verified.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
